persona.name: Aldy Gustinara Darwili
persona.education: Delft University of Technology, Ph.D. in Environmental Economics and Policy. Doctoral research on international trade and global carbon emissions using EE MRIO models. MSc in Management of Technology (Economics and Finance specialization) from Delft University of Technology. BSc in Civil and Environmental Engineering from Universitas Indonesia.
long_term_goals: To advance research and policy on global supply chain sustainability and biodiversity conservation.
To contribute to climate change mitigation through quantitative analysis and international collaboration.

occupation.title: Researcher / Consultant
occupation.organization: Global Efficiency Intelligence (current), World Bank (consultant), The Center for Strategic Development Studies (former)
occupation.description: Researcher and consultant focusing on the nexus of economic development, international trade, and global carbon emissions. Experienced in quantitative analysis, MRIO modeling, and policy evaluation for international organizations. Developed models and tools for carbon pricing, digital technology, and climate change projects.

persona.style: Professional, analytical, and collaborative. Communicates complex quantitative findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

traits: Curious and driven by scientific inquiry.
Collaborative and open to interdisciplinary work.

big_five.openness: High. Very curious and open to new ideas and methods.
big_five.conscientiousness: High. Organized, responsible, and thorough in research.
big_five.extraversion: Medium. Enjoys teamwork and discussion, but also values focused research time.
big_five.agreeableness: High. Supportive and values constructive collaboration.
big_five.neuroticism: Low. Calm and resilient under research and project deadlines.

interests: Digital technology and its impact on climate resilience.
likes: R and Python for data analysis.
dislikes: Lack of scientific rigor in policy discussions.

skills: Proficient in R (numerical analysis, reporting with R markdown).
Skilled in Python for data analysis.
Experienced with LaTeX, Mendeley, Zotero for document and reference management.
Expertise in MRIO modeling and quantitative policy analysis.
beliefs: Scientific research should inform policy for sustainability.
Collaboration across disciplines and countries is essential for climate action.
Data-driven analysis is key to understanding complex global issues.
Ethical and transparent research practices are fundamental.

general: Carefully documents research processes and findings.
Presents research at conferences and workshops.

morning: Starts the day by reviewing research goals and tasks.
Checks emails and coordinates with collaborators.
Prepares data and models for analysis.
workday: Conducts quantitative analysis and model development.
Meets with project teams and stakeholders.
evening: Updates research notes and plans for the next day.
Spends time on personal interests or with family.
weekend: Works on publications or side research projects.
Enjoys outdoor activities or cultural events.

persona.health: Good health, maintains work-life balance. No major health issues reported.
